createGedcom

Provides for creation of Gedcom 6.0 xml files.

See:
          Description

Packages
jaxb.gedcom Provides simple interfaces to main gedcom creation operations.

 

Provides for creation of Gedcom 6.0 xml files. It requires Jaxb 2.0 in order to run. Jaxb 2.0 can be obtained as a part of Sun's JWSDP 2.0 Java Web Services Developer Pack version 2.0. To build, edit build.xml and set 'jaxb.home' to the location of the JWSDP jaxb/lib folder on your hard drive.

Usage

Use the gedcom package to create GEDCOM 6.0 xml files. See the CreateGedcomExample.java file in the example folder for an example of how to use this library.

Start by instantiating a GEDCOM object, then create a HeaderRec and set the Header in the GEDCOM object. Next, add IndividualRec, FamilyRec, SourceRec, EventRec, ContactRec, and GroupRec objects. Lastly, print the GEDCOM xml out to a file using a JAXBContext. Here is how you print a GEDCOM object using a JAXBContext. 

        private void print(GEDCOM ged, String filename) throws Exception {
                JAXBContext jc = JAXBContext.newInstance("jaxb.gedcom");

                // create a Marshaller and marshal to filename
                Marshaller m = jc.createMarshaller();
                m.setProperty(Marshaller.JAXB_FORMATTED_OUTPUT, Boolean.TRUE);
                FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(filename);
                ged.marshal(m, out);
                out.close();            
        }
